subject: Communication
title: Gestures That Get Lost in Translation
description: A fast breakdown of Gestures That Get Lost in Translation for builders.

hook.text: The 'thumbs up' means 'great' in the US. In parts of the Middle East, it's an obscene insult.

buildup.text: Most gestures are culturally specific, not universal. Head nodding means 'yes' in most cultures â€” but 'no' in Bulgaria.

discovery.text: The 'OK' sign is positive in the US, means zero in France, and is offensive in Brazil. One hand, three meanings.

twist.text: Even pointing is cultural. Americans point with a finger; Malaysians point with their thumb; Laotians point with their.

climax.text: The safest approach abroad: observe local gestures before using your own. When in doubt, use fewer hand movements.

punchline.text: Your body speaks a language. Make sure it's the right one.

quiz.question: What does the 'thumbs up' gesture mean in parts of the Middle East?
